Entity: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
Description: Get the prescriptions you need through the Emergency Prescription Assistance Program.

Apply by March 31, 2025, for FEMA disaster assistance to get 14 days to several months of temporary housing support. This can include rental assistance and hotel or other short-term lodging reimbursement.
Apply by March 31, 2025 for FEMA disaster assistance. Get help with losses not covered by insurance — including temporary housing, repairs, and rebuilding.

Apply by March 31, 2025, for a loan to repair physical damage to your business. Businesses of any size can apply. Apply by October 25, 2025, for a loan to cover economic losses to your small business.

Service_name: Business use tax or fee extension and relief
Entity: California Department of Tax and Fee Administration
Description: Get relief from penalties, collection costs, and interest. You can also get up to a 3-month filing extension on your tax returns.
Learn about the extended deadline to file and pay business income tax in Los Angeles County. The new deadline is October 15, 2025.

Service_name: Employer payroll tax and reporting extension
Description: Get an extension of up to two months to file state payroll reports and deposit state payroll taxes, without penalty or interest.
Mail:
Employment Development Department
PO Box 826880
Sacramento, CA 94280-0001

Entity: California Office of the Small Business Advocate
Description: CalOSBA offers resources and support for businesses and workers impacted by the wildfires. This includes financial help, recovery programs, and workforce support.
If you lost your job, apply for unemployment benefits.
If you are sick or injured from the fires, apply for disability benefits.
If you need time off work to care for your family, apply for Paid Family Leave.
Find job search tools like CalJOBS and other resources to help you find employment.
General support, referrals, and training to find a new job in California.
Apply for a new job on CalJOBS, California’s online job exchange system.

Service_name: WIC food benefits for women and children
Description: Get monthly benefits from the California Women, Infants and Children (WIC) program. Use these benefits to buy food for yourself and your children. You can also get nutrition and breastfeeding support.
CalFresh can help your family get access to healthy food. You can use monthly CalFresh benefits at most grocery stores and even farmers markets.
Find locations near you where you can get free food and groceries.
Find resources and tips to take care of your mental health after a wildfire.

Entity: California Governor's Office of Emergency Services
Description: Find a current list of open shelters available for communities impacted by the fires.

Entity: California Department of Financial Protection & Innovation
Description: Get mortgage relief for structures damaged or destroyed by the LA fires. Temporarily reduce or pause mortgage payments, waive late fees, and more.

If you've already received the maximum amount of FEMA disaster assistance, you may be eligible for a grant from California's State Supplemental Grant Program (SSGP). FEMA will automatically apply on your behalf. You don't need to apply directly for these state disaster grants.

Entity: California Department of Food and Agriculture
Description: Get help if you lost a pet, had to leave a pet behind, or need shelter for your pet.
Find information and guides to disaster assistance for immigrant Californians. Available in Spanish, simplified Chinese, traditional Chinese, and Armenian.
Find tips and resources to help you with insurance claims and issues.
Learn about the state law that prevents insurance companies from canceling or not renewing home insurance policies for one year after a wildfire. And find out if your zip code is protected.
Get help filing an insurance claim or resolving an issue with a claim you already filed.
Replace California driver's licenses or IDs. Fees are waived for licenses or IDs lost in the fires.
Replace titles for vehicles registered in California. Fees are waived for titles lost in the fires.

Entity: California Department of Housing and Community Development
Description: Replace manufactued and mobilehome registration and titling documents.

Service_name: Personal income tax documents and info
Description: Replace personal tax documents. File critical changes of information such as change of address and power of attorney.
Learn how to replace service records (DD 214), awards, and medals.
Get free certified replacement copies of birth, death, and marriage records. Spanish forms also available.
Unlicensed contractors often prey on survivors of disasters. To protect yourself, find a licensed contractor near you.
Verify a professional contractor's license. Each record lists a license status as expired, suspended, or revoked.
Work with a case manager from Catholic Charities of California who can guide you through the recovery process.
If you have CalVet home insurance, learn how to file a claim.
Find CalVet information and resources for veterans and their families affected by the Los Angeles wildfires.
Learn about the extended deadline to file and pay income tax in Los Angeles County. The new deadline is October 15, 2025.

For those impacted by the LA fires, Governor Newsom has suspended penalties and interest on late property tax payments. The state property tax deadline is also extended. The new deadline is April 10, 2026. Learn about the extended deadline to file and pay property taxes.
Get property tax relief if your home was damaged or destroyed.
Here’s what you need to know before you return to your home.

Entity: South Coast Air Quality Monitoring District
Description: Check your air quality through the South Coast Air Quality Monitoring District.
Replace Disabled Person Parking Placard.
Replace license plates and registration stickers.
File a change of address.
Replace vehicle or driver's records.
Learn about disaster relief protections to help with your energy, natural gas, water, landline, and mobile phone bills.
Contact crisis hotlines to get immediate mental health support.
New online service to get a certified copy of a birth record. This process is entirely online and free for people affected by the LA fires.
New online service to get a certified copy of a death record. This process is entirely online and free for people affected by the LA fires.
New online service to get a certified copy of a marriage record. This process is entirely online and free for people affected by the LA fires.

Service_name: Replace birth, death, and marriage records (Spanish Version)
Description: Replacements are free if you lost these vital records in the fires. Must visit a notary. (Spanish Version)

Entity: California Health and Human Services Agency
Description: Find digital mental health programs and support for youth, young adults, and families.

Service_name: Safety information for fire cleanup workers
Description: If you work in fire cleanup or debris removal, learn about safety gear and employee protections.
See the major steps to take when rebuilding your home. This includes insurance claims, permits, and more.
Opt in by March 31, 2025, to get free government debris removal. If you don't opt in, you'll need to pay for a private debris removal contractor instead.
Apply by March 12, 2025, for cash assistance grants for small businesses and nonprofits.

Service_name: Disaster loans for homeowners and renters
Description: Apply by March 31, 2025, for a loan to repair your home or replace personal property damaged in the fires.
